glsa.title: zip: Path name buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: zip contains a buffer overflow when creating a ZIP archive of files with very long path names. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: zip is a compression and file packaging utility.

description.p: zip does not check the resulting path length when doing recursive folder compression.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this by enticing another user or web application to create an archive including a specially-crafted path name, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running zip.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All zip users should upgrade to the latest version:
